description: Access Intelligence – an integrated media company, acquired a client of mine called NextCustomer in 2012 along with the LeadsCon and DailyDeal conferences, plus DMConfidential.com and other events and online properties.
name: Access Intelligence

description:
Founded in 2003 AdBrite was an online advertising network then became ad exchange in 2008. They grew to reach more than 160 million U.S. unique visitors each month through display and video ads. The company cease operations and shut down services in 2013.

I worked in-house for a short period as a freelance contractor and would bring my own laptop to work on projects such as registration path redesign, banner ads, conference booth graphics, and printed brochures about the company.
name: AdBrite

description: Adobe is best known for it’s image editing software Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Premier, Adobe Lightroom, and the Acrobat PDF format. Additionally they also produce software for web design, video special effects, audio editing, eLearning, digital marketing tools, and web server software.
name: Adobe

description: ADP, LLC (formerly Automatic Data Processing, Inc.)
name: ADP

description: Adteractive was a performance-based advertising and marketing company in San Francisco focused on lead generation for its clients and partners. They generated customer acquisitions and billed for each new prospective lead on a CPA basis. After I was hired in 2007 Adteractive received it’s first ever venture capital investment of $5.1M and was valued at over $125M.
name: Adteractive

description: Originally known as  America Online, AOL began around 1985 and has grown to become a mega global media powerhouse. I was involved growing customer engagement just at the time about half of all U.S. homes with Internet access had it through AOL. While working on various content channels – including News (AOL Live!), Sports (The Sporting News), Family Computing, Travel, Shopping, and Entertainment – the company experienced their greatest growth.
name: AOL

description:
Non-profit organization founded in 1997 for the purpose of increasing public awareness of and appreciation for the study and practice of calligraphy and lettering arts through exhibitions.

Early in my career this was a pro-bono redesign I submitted in exchange for a letter of reference.
name: Association for the Calligraphic Arts

description:
KHN Solutions created both the BACtrack and BluFire brands. I’ve categorized work for each separately, but it was actually work for just one company.

Founded in 2001, BACtrack is the leading brand of breathalyzers offering a full range of innovative breath alcohol testers for both personal and professional use. They are the first company to ever receive U.S. Food & Drug Administration 510(k) marketing clearance to legally sell breathalyzers to consumers for personal use. BACtrack products are available in 20 countries and at over 10,000 retail store locations including Walgreens, Costco and Best Buy.
name: BACtrack

description: BARRA helped manage trading risks for investment portfolios. I was involved with the first couple iterations of their website and online products around 1997. In 2004 Barra was acquired by MSCI.
name: Barra Financial

description:
KHN Solutions created both the BACtrack and BluFire brands. I've categorized work for each separately, but it was actually work for just one company.

BluFire helped pioneer the consumer market for advanced health and safety devices. BluFire first offered breathalyzers online in 2001 and positioned them as an entertaining safety device that should be used by everyone consuming alcohol. Since then the company has expanded into body fat scales, digital thermometers, pedometers, and other consumer products.
name: BluFire

description: Startup company.
name: Brillian Technologies

description: Sold to Regus October 2015. BusinesSuites offers premium executive office suites, virtual office services and meeting rooms to companies of all sizes. Originally established in 1989 in Austin, Texas they now serve as home for thousands of professionals, entrepreneurs, and employees in their growing network of locations throughout the United States.
name: BusinesSuites

description: Using a network of multiple websites, CalFinder markets a range of construction and home improvement services from kitchen renovations, bathroom remodeling, home additions, window replacement, air conditioning and heating, siding installation and repair, general remodeling, and more. They are then able to connect homeowners with home remodeling contractors. The contractors receive qualified leads which are pre-screened and locally zoned so they can easy create estimates and grow their business.
name: CalFinder

description: Cambridge Consultants is a world-class supplier of innovative product development engineering and technology consulting.
name: Cambridge Consultants

description: Claria Corporation was a leader in online behavioral marketing, serving tens of millions of consumers and more than 1,000 advertisers. Claria published advertising messages for top tier companies and agencies to tens of millions of consumers based on their online behavior. Claria advertising services were branded the GAIN Network (Gator) and BehaviorLink.
name: Claria

description: ApartmentSearch.com
name: CORT Business Services, Apartment Search

description: I first began working with EchoSign August of 2008 through PPC Associates then more directly starting around October 2010. April 2011 I stepped in and began managing their marketing website content and design and helped redesign the site to fit the Adobe standard look and feel in February of 2012 after Adobe acquired EchoSign (July 2011). From February 2012 through October 2012 I continued to maintain the site and eventually, while working with a small army of Adobe employees and outside contractors, we migrated the site to Adobes enterprise content management system and they began managing the site internally.
name: EchoSign

description: FiftyFlowers.com specializes in beautiful flowers delivered at wholesale prices direct from the grower. Their farms are located throughout the Andes Mountain region of Ecuador and rank as one of the top flower producers in the world. For over 20 years they have been shipping more than one million flowers a month all over the world and the team at FiftyFlowers.com knows the flower industry inside and out.
name: FiftyFlowers.com

description: Formed in 1996 as “The World Capital of Helmets”, Helmet City has become a well-known name in the motorsports and motorcycle markets. They've grown to carry an extensive inventory and have relationships with a broad range of suppliers.
name: Helmet City

description: Founded in 2009, HomeRun was one of the nation's premier daily deals websites. The online social buying club promoted “Daily Steals” which provided customer discounts on goods and services from various merchants in more than 30 major American cities, including San Francisco, Atlanta, Washington, D.C., New York, Detroit, and Portland. Acquired by Deem in 2011.
name: HomeRun.com

description: IMVU is an online virtual world (or “metaverse”, similar to Second Life or The Sims) where members use 3D avatars to meet new people, chat, create, and play games. Founded in 2004, they have the largest 3D-based user-generated virtual goods catalog consisting of more than 30 million items. They’re also known as one of the leading practitioners of the lean startup approach.
name: IMVU

description:
Insightly is a cloud based CRM and project management tool for small and medium businesses which integrates with G Suite, Microsoft Office and several other applications.

While working with the company my primary role was as front-end developer for www.insightly.com which involved maintaining the HTML, CSS, Javascript for their marketing site, creating a few html emails, a few banner ads and landing pages, plus occasional visual design projects when needed. Working with their in-house designers, developers, other contractors, and vendors I would create mockups, code prototypes, and integrate with marketing tools such as Marketo and Optimizely. Besides doing a lot of the A/B testing using Optimizely ourselves we eventually added services such as Experiment Engine, GetSmartContent, and Captora to help manage growing testing needs.

There were three major site redesigns while I was with the company as we created new sections, integrated internationalization (i18n) solutions localizing (l10n) site content for three additional languages. As part of the third redesign I built out the responsive web site design for the site by creating four additional layouts for each page and coding those break-points for mobile devices. The site was initially Microsoft .Net ASP based and I managed it using Visual Studio. Eventually we migrated to a WordPress CMS PHP configuration including custom themes and plugins I developed. We also migrated the corporate blog from Blogger to the WordPress platform and created a new design for it. In addition, the support site would occasionally need updating and design tweaks were needed along with their Facebook page, Youtube channel, and other online areas.
name: Insightly

description:
In 1979 the Sequoia Union High School District, which owns the broadcast license for KCEA 89.1 FM, established it as a high school radio station. The station features big band music from the 30's and 40's 24 hours a day. Also the frequency serves as a disaster information station for the surrounding area.

KCEA has a library of over a thousand albums and compact discs of the big band era, which is always expanding. KCEA produces and airs free Public Service Anouncements (PSA's) for local events such as concerts, dances, community activities, and information on consumer and health awareness.
name: KCEA Radio 89.1 FM

description: KHN Solutions created both the BACtrack and BluFire brands. I've categorized work for each separately, but it was actually work for just one company.
name: KHN Solutions

name: Kwanzoo

description: The studio known for creating and producing the Star Wars and Indiana Jones franchises.

description: An integrated marketing solutions agency.
name: Marriner Marketing Communications

description: Narus Inc. was a software company founded in 1997 and was a vendor of big data analytics for cybersecurity. The company was first acquired by Boeing then sold to Symantec.
name: Narus

description: Art Director, Cheryl Poindexter, Studio City, California - I need to scan in more work from this client.
name: Poindexter Design Group

description: Start-up test.
name: QuantBench

description:
Originally founded in 2006 as ReputationDefender, Reputation.com is an online reputation management company that turns customers into advocates by building reputations online, improving customer service experience, and improving financial results. The Redwood City, California company's products and services are designed to help both businesses and individuals monitor, manage, and improve the way they appear online, across search engines, reviews, and social media.

As Reputation.com was rapidly expanding and workload bandwidth increased their internal Art Director and Marketing Manager were looking to outsource projects on an as-needed basis. Focus was on developing the brand messaging and visual design concepts for each product line to better reach potential customers in more effective ways.
name: Reputation.com

description: Yeah - it’s just me :p
name: Self

description: StellaService measures, benchmarks, and evaluates businesses based on the overall quality of the online customer experience. By stress-testing customer service performance across hundreds of metrics they are able to give actionable insight to both businesses and consumers.
name: StellaService

description: Clients included Disney Home Video, Fox Home Video, MCA, Polygram, Sony Wonder, Virgin Sound and Vision, Warner Home Entertainment and others. Location: Pasadena, California
name: The MacPhee Group

description: TixNix is a legal directory that links attorneys and clients in a virtual network that is optimized towards managing clients. The service offers tools that make it easy for any attorney or law firm to offer traffic ticket services to prospective clients at competitive rates.
name: TixNix

description: Trusted Hands Network is a marketplace connecting qualified healthcare providers with families needing home care nationwide in the United States.
name: Trusted Hands Network

description: VDOPhone is a peer-to-peer video chat software application.
name: VDO

description: SingleFeed helps online merchants submit, manage, and optimize product listings on comparison shopping sites like Google Product Search, PriceGrabber and others. The service helps merchants improve engagement, visits and transactions by being listed on more shopping engines which they state can drive between 15 and 40% of an online store’s monthly visits Acquired by Alibaba-owned Vendio June 2011.
name: Vendio SingleFeed

description: At Yahoo! I worked within the Cost-per-Lead (CPL) group and focused on lead generation, performance marketing, and brand advertising primarily for the finance and mortgage industries.
name: Yahoo!

description: Zuberance helps companies identify and activate brand advocates through social media and word-of-mouth (WOM) campaigns.
name: Zuberance
